instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437 No 5v
threads.message:
Hey guys.

This one was working fine. Refused to turn on one day. NO drop. NO waterdamage.
Upon inspection found short on ppbus_g3h. Removed short.

I cant see pp5v_s5 missing.

threads.title: 820-3437 No 5v
threads.message:
So many questions..
Do you have a light/ any fan spin now? Where was the short and is it gone now? Did you replace the component? 
What do you mean you can’t see pp5v_s5 missing?
How does U7501, J4800/L4820/C4810 and U7400 look?

threads.title: 820-3437 No 5v
threads.message: You actually give no information....the usual plz. PPBUS, light?, 3v3_s5? etc.

when i say pp5v is missing i mean its 0v
U7501, J4800/L4820/C4810 and U7400 look fine

pp3v42 3.4v

threads.title: 820-3437 No 5v
threads.message: Ok so you don't have 8.6 volts at PPBUS which is the problem. Is SMC_RESET_L present?

threads.title: 820-3437 No 5v
threads.message: No light and PPBUS at 8.2V means SMC is not running. Check SMC_RESET and check for crap in SMC area or dead SMC.

threads.title: 820-3437 No 5v
threads.message: Did you try a good i/o board and cable? Good power supply?

threads.title: 820-3437 No 5v
threads.message:
"Did you try a good i/o board and cable? Good power supply? "

I am sorry but this has NOTHING to do with PPBUS being 8.2V. That is just swapping parts and hoping it helps. You should diagnose, not swapping parts.

threads.title: 820-3437 No 5v
threads.message:

threads.title: 820-3437 No 5v
threads.message: Crap under SMC or dead SMC

threads.title: 820-3437 No 5v
threads.message: n00b question,... can smc be replaced?

threads.title: 820-3437 No 5v
threads.message: Yes but has to come from identical donor board so has to come from 820-3437
